channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.description:

item.title: Report X-2024010174
item.description:
Report X-2024010174

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded off truck and in transit to Van lines when manager contact QA in regards to leaking packing. DescribePack: Clip on paint can failed causing content to leak DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a lined red Hazmat tote and taking to the QA area for pressings,

item.title: Report E-2024010310
item.description:
Report E-2024010310

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of Sikadur®-35 Hi-Mod LV Part A (UN3082 9, III) were released from one 2-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by XKC. The release impacted the concrete near the OS&D dock. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1)10 gallon DM containing one 2-gallon metal pail of Sikadur®-35 Hi-Mod LV Part A and oil dri was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010182
item.description:
Report X-2024010182

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: COLBY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found during unload on trailer. 1 box with 2 containers of disinfectant leaking from nozzle. Package was not loaded on floor. PH notified manager who confirmed no additional contamination and removed package from work area. DescribePack: Leaking nozzle on 2 containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed contents and packaging inside of hazmat tote, cleared area of contamination to resume work.

item.title: Report X-2024010276
item.description:
Report X-2024010276

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a package handler was working in the IC belt, he noticed that a package was on it sided and wet. he told to his manager and they called QA,. DescribePack: One gallon got loose cap and spilled out some of the contens. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA went to the area and put the package in a tote line with a hazmat bag and brought to the processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2024010256
item.description:
Report X-2024010256

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver coded a 10. Admin found on truck laying sideways with directional arrows. Manager looked up SDS to confirm undeclared Hazmat. DescribePack: Loose caps and dented products causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put right side up then transported to QA in a black tote. Once processing was completed, entire package was put in a sealed salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024010293
item.description:
Report X-2024010293

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a package handler was in the IC belt, he noticed that a package was leaking, he told to his manger and they called QA. DescribePack: The package got crack in the bottom seal and spilled out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA went to the area with a tote line with a hazmat bag and pick the package and bright to the processing cage.
